New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
The Cavaliers ended their NBA-record streak of scoring 110 points in 10 consecutive wins.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter, including two free throws that put the Cavaliers ahead for good.
Cam Johnson made a three-pointer with 4:23 left, but the Cavaliers responded with a 10-point run to turn the game around.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland Cavaliersâ€™ coach Kenny Atkinson acknowledged the game's importance and highlighted Evan Mobley's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Cavaliers' third win in a row, matching a franchise record last achieved in 2017.
The Nets had significant performances from Cam Johnson and Dennis Schroder.
Others: The Cavaliers are two victories away from matching the longest streak in franchise history.
